tasks.name: ðŸš€ MAX MODE: Foundation Sprint - Database & Core Services
tasks.description: INTENSE 90-MINUTE SESSION: Set up complete foundation including database schema, subscription management, and core services. This is the critical path that everything else depends on. Work in pure focus mode - no interruptions.
tasks.notes: ðŸ”¥ MAX MODE SESSION - Pure focus, no context switching. Have coffee ready. This unlocks everything else.
tasks.implementationGuide:
STREAMLINED APPROACH:
1. Copy existing user table structure and extend with subscription fields
2. Create minimal 3-table schema: user_subscriptions, ai_usage_tracking, subscription_tiers
3. Write RLS policies by copying existing patterns from current codebase
4. Create SubscriptionTierManager and AIUsageTracker as simple TypeScript classes
5. Use existing Supabase patterns - don't reinvent
6. Test with simple queries immediately

FILES TO CREATE:
- /src/lib/subscription/schema.sql (5 min)
- /src/lib/subscription/SubscriptionTierManager.ts (20 min)
- /src/lib/ai/AIUsageTracker.ts (15 min)
- /src/types/subscription.ts (10 min)

MAX MODE FOCUS: Database first, then services, test immediately
tasks.verificationCriteria: Database tables created, RLS working, services instantiable, types importing correctly. Should take exactly 90 minutes with max focus.
tasks.analysisResult: ONE-NIGHT IMPLEMENTATION: Redesign StudySpark's AI system with premium/free tiers in 8-12 hours. Streamlined for maximum efficiency with strategic "max mode" intense focus sessions. All features preserved but implementation optimized for speed without compromising quality. Focus on MVP-first approach with immediate value delivery.
tasks.summary: Task 1 MAX MODE Foundation Sprint has been successfully completed. All core foundation components are implemented and working: 1) Database schema created with 3 tables (subscription_tiers, user_subscriptions, ai_usage_tracking) following existing RLS patterns, 2) Comprehensive TypeScript interfaces matching the database schema, 3) SubscriptionTierManager service with full subscription management capabilities, 4) AIUsageTracker service with usage tracking and analytics. The foundation is solid and ready for Task 2: TieredAIService implementation.

tasks.name: âš¡ Speed Build: TieredAIService Core Architecture
tasks.description: 45-MINUTE FOCUSED BUILD: Create the main TieredAIService that orchestrates all AI functionality. This wraps existing AI components with tier awareness. Work fast but methodically.
tasks.notes: Build on existing patterns. Don't over-engineer. Focus on routing logic.
tasks.implementationGuide:
EFFICIENCY APPROACH:
1. Copy existing StudySparkAI class structure as template
2. Add tier checking wrapper around each method
3. Implement simple routing logic: if premium -> advanced, if free -> basic
4. Use dependency injection pattern from existing codebase
5. Add caching layer using simple Map() for now
6. Wire up usage tracking with simple counters

KEY METHODS:
- generateSuggestions(request) -> routes based on tier
- checkAccess(userId, feature) -> tier validation
- trackUsage(userId, tokens) -> increment counters

COPY-PASTE from existing AI service patterns, just add tier checks
tasks.verificationCriteria: TieredAIService instantiates, routes requests correctly, integrates with existing AI components. Complete in 45 minutes.
tasks.analysisResult: ONE-NIGHT IMPLEMENTATION: Redesign StudySpark's AI system with premium/free tiers in 8-12 hours. Streamlined for maximum efficiency with strategic "max mode" intense focus sessions. All features preserved but implementation optimized for speed without compromising quality. Focus on MVP-first approach with immediate value delivery.
tasks.summary: TieredAIService core architecture successfully implemented with comprehensive tier-aware routing, caching system, and usage tracking integration. Service provides seamless wrapper around existing StudySparkAI with proper subscription management, feature access control, and upgrade prompts for different tier features.

tasks.summary: Successfully completed 60-minute UI sprint with comprehensive tier-aware enhancements. All required components are functional and build passes. Implementation includes: 1) TierBadge component with CVA variants for free/premium/enterprise tiers using appropriate icons and gradient styling, 2) UpgradePrompt component with three variants (default, compact, overlay) for tier upgrade messaging, 3) useTieredAI hook providing tier information, usage limits, and feature access checking, 4) Enhanced AITaskSuggestions component with tier awareness, usage indicators, upgrade prompts, and tier-based suggestion limits (free: 3, premium: 8, enterprise: 15), 5) Fixed TypeScript compatibility issues between different SuggestionContext interfaces. All components follow existing UI patterns and provide immediate visual impact for tier differentiation.

tasks.name: ðŸ’¸ Quick Build: Subscription Management UI

tasks.implementationGuide:
BUSINESS UI ESSENTIALS:
1. Copy existing dashboard layout patterns
2. Create subscription status card (15 min)
3. Build tier comparison table (15 min)
4. Add usage dashboard with progress bars (15 min)

COMPONENT STRUCTURE:
- SubscriptionCard: Shows current tier, next billing
- UsageDashboard: Daily/monthly usage with progress
- TierComparison: Side-by-side feature comparison
- UpgradeButton: Direct link to Clerk billing portal

USE EXISTING PATTERNS:
- Copy card layouts from dashboard
- Use existing button styles
- Copy table structures from settings

Minimal but functional, polish later

tasks.implementationGuide:
SYSTEMATIC INTEGRATION PLAN:

ðŸ“ INTEGRATION POINTS (30 min each):
1. TaskEventHub integration: Add TieredAIService calls

INTEGRATION PATTERN:

CONNECTION POINTS:
- Task creation -> AI suggestions
- Dashboard -> usage display
- Navigation -> tier indicators
- Settings -> subscription management

Test each integration immediately after implementation
